qas.question: In what kinds of nations can the head of government attain the title of Excellency?
What honorific title can be given to prime ministers in commonwealth nations?
What are British prime ministers part of that grants them the title Right Honourable?

answers.text: Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council

qas.question: What is an example of a country where prime ministers can be called Right Honourable solely because of their position?
What is the prime minister entitled to in Commonwealth countries?

plausible_answers.text: prime ministers and former prime ministers

qas.question: Who is called Honourable in non Commonwealth countries?

plausible_answers.text: the prime minister and former prime ministers

qas.question: Who can not be part of the privy council?

context: In <a0_0>non-Commonwealth countries<a0_0/> the prime minister may be entitled to <b4_0>the style of Excellency<b4_0/> like a president. In some Commonwealth countries <b5_0>prime ministers and former prime ministers<b5_0/> are styled <a1_0>Right Honourable<a1_0/> due to their position, for example in the Prime Minister of <a3_0>Canada<a3_0/>. In the United Kingdom <b6_0>the prime minister and former prime ministers<b6_0/> may appear to also be styled Right Honourable, however this is not due to their position as head of government but as a privilege of being current members of <a2_0>Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council<a2_0/>.
